summary: This is an FBI 302 form documenting an interview with a BOP Captain from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) regarding the supervision and death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein. The Captain details Epstein's housing status, manipulative behavior, the July 23 incident, and the circumstances leading up to Epstein's death on August 10, 2019, including failures in protocol regarding cellmate assignment and rounds.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: High-profile inmate at MCC who was found unresponsive in his cell on August 10, 2019. The interview details his manipulative behavior to avoid cellmates, his placement on suicide watch, and the circumstances surrounding his death.

persons.name: Captain
persons.context: The interviewee, a BOP Captain at MCC who oversaw security. He provided details on Epstein's supervision, housing assignments, staff directives, and the events leading to Epstein's death.

persons.name: Warden
persons.context: The Warden of MCC who directed that Epstein must have a cellmate at all times and was involved in reviewing potential cellmates. He was present at the facility on the morning of Epstein's death.

persons.name: Associate Warden
persons.context: Notified by the Captain on the morning of Epstein's death. Also informed about staff admissions regarding failure to complete rounds and counts.

persons.name: Lieutenant
persons.context: The Special Housing Unit (SHU) Lieutenant who was repeatedly directed by the Captain that Epstein needed a cellmate. He was on leave on August 9, 2019.

persons.name: Lieutenant
persons.context: The Operations Lieutenant who had oversight of the SHU on August 9, 2019, in the absence of the SHU Lieutenant. He was aware Epstein required a cellmate.

persons.name: Lieutenant
persons.context: Called the Captain around 7:00 AM on August 10, 2019, to inform him Epstein was found unresponsive and that Epstein did not have a cellmate.

persons.name: Lieutenant
persons.context: Relieved another officer on the 10 PM - 6 AM shift on August 9, 2019. The Captain did not personally tell her Epstein required a cellmate.

persons.name: Mr.
persons.context: The camera technician who notified the Captain he was working on the SHU camera system earlier in the week of Epstein's death.

persons.name: Institution Duty Officer
persons.context: One of the individuals the Captain attempted to call on the morning of August 10, 2019, for more information about Epstein's death.

connections.description: The Captain was responsible for overseeing security and Epstein's supervision at MCC, including housing assignments and special accommodations.
The Captain reported to the Warden, who directed the policy that Epstein must have a cellmate. The Captain compiled and vetted cellmate candidates for the Warden's review.
The Captain directly supervised the SHU Lieutenant and repeatedly directed him that Epstein needed a cellmate at all times.
The Warden set the directive that Epstein must have a cellmate and was involved in the review process for selecting his cellmates.

events.title: Epstein Found Unresponsive in Cell
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive on the floor of his cell with a homemade piece of fabric on his chest. His cellmate flagged staff. Epstein claimed his cellmate tried to kill him. He was placed on suicide watch.

events.title: Epstein's Last Day Before Death
events.description: Epstein had an attorney session. His cellmate was released from court and his property was removed from the cell, leaving Epstein without a cellmate. The SHU camera system was down.

events.title: Epstein Found Dead
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell without a cellmate in the early morning. Staff admitted to not completing 30-minute rounds, 3:00 AM, and 5:00 AM counts.

events.title: FBI Interview of BOP Captain
events.description: The BOP Captain was interviewed by FBI and OIG agents regarding the supervision and death of Jeffrey Epstein at MCC.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007
FBI New York Field Office, 290 Broadway, New York, NY 10278
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at MCC on the morning of August 10, 2019, without a cellmate despite a standing order from the Warden that he must have one at all times.

Epstein had a history of manipulative behavior to avoid having a cellmate, including requesting psychological assessments and being placed on suicide watch after a July 23 incident where he was found unresponsive.
On August 9, 2019, Epstein's cellmate was released from court, his property was removed, and Epstein was left alone. Staff failed to notify the Captain of this change.
Staff admitted to not completing mandatory 30-minute rounds and 3:00 AM/5:00 AM inmate counts on the night of Epstein's death. The camera system in the SHU was also down.
The Captain had verbally, but informally, instructed his Lieutenants that Epstein required a cellmate. There was no formal meeting or email documenting the Warden's directive.
